qas.question: What Island is the mandolin a main instrument in Cretan Music?
When did the mandolin appears on Crete?

answers.text: around the time of the Venetian rule of the island.

qas.question: What was one of the variants of the mandolin that was used?
Who reported that the mandolin and the mpoulgari were used to accompany the lyria?
The mandolin was reported to be popular among what sex?
What Island is the mandolin not a main instrument in Cretan Music?

plausible_answers.text: around the time of the Venetian rule

qas.question: When did the mandolin leave Crete?
What was one of the variants of the mandolin that was never used?
Who reported that the mandolin and the mpoulgari were not used to accompany the lyria?
The mandolin was reported to be unpopular among what sex?

context: On the <a0_0>island of <b5_0>Crete<b5_0/><a0_0/>, along with the lyra and the laouto (lute), the mandolin is one of the main instruments used in Cretan Music. It appeared on Crete <a1_0><b6_0>around the time of the Venetian rule<b6_0/> of the island.<a1_0/> Different variants of the mandolin, such as the "<a2_0><b7_0>mantola<b7_0/><a2_0/>," were used to accompany the lyra, the violin, and the laouto. <a3_0><b8_0>Stelios Foustalierakis<b8_0/><a3_0/> reported that the mandolin and the mpoulgari were used to accompany the lyra in the beginning of the 20th century in the city of Rethimno. There are also reports that the mandolin was mostly a <a4_0><b9_0>woman<a4_0/>'s<b9_0/> musical instrument. Nowadays it is played mainly as a solo instrument in personal and family events on the Ionian islands and Crete.
